parameters.name: EndpointArn
parameters.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) string that uniquely identifies the endpoint.

nested_items.name: EndpointIdentifier
nested_items.description: The database endpoint identifier. Identifiers must begin with a letter and must contain only ASCII letters, digits, and hyphens. They can't end with a hyphen or contain two consecutive hyphens.

nested_items.name: EndpointType
nested_items.description: The type of endpoint. Valid values are source and target.

nested_items.name: EngineName
nested_items.description: The database engine name. Valid values, depending on the EndpointType, include "mysql", "oracle", "postgres", "mariadb", "aurora", "aurora-postgresql", "redshift", "redshift-serverless", "s3", "db2", "db2-zos", "azuredb", "sybase", "dynamodb", "mongodb", "kinesis", "kafka", "elasticsearch", "documentdb", "sqlserver", "neptune", and "babelfish".

nested_items.name: EngineDisplayName
nested_items.description: The expanded name for the engine name. For example, if the EngineName parameter is 'aurora', this value would be 'Amazon Aurora MySQL'.

nested_items.name: Username
nested_items.description: The user name used to connect to the endpoint.

nested_items.name: ServerName
nested_items.description: The name of the server at the endpoint.

nested_items.name: Port
nested_items.description: The port value used to access the endpoint.

nested_items.name: DatabaseName
nested_items.description: The name of the database at the endpoint.

nested_items.name: ExtraConnectionAttributes
nested_items.description: Additional connection attributes used to connect to the endpoint.

nested_items.name: Status
nested_items.description: The status of the endpoint.

nested_items.name: KmsKeyId
nested_items.description: An KMS key identifier that is used to encrypt the connection parameters for the endpoint.

nested_items.name: EndpointArn
nested_items.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) string that uniquely identifies the endpoint.

nested_items.name: CertificateArn
nested_items.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) used for SSL connection to the endpoint.

nested_items.name: SslMode
nested_items.description: The SSL mode used to connect to the endpoint. The default value is none.

nested_items.name: ServiceAccessRoleArn
nested_items.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) used by the service to access the IAM role. The role must allow the iam:PassRole action.

nested_items.name: ExternalTableDefinition
nested_items.description: The external table definition.

nested_items.name: ExternalId
nested_items.description: Value returned by a call to CreateEndpoint that can be used for cross-account validation. Use it on a subsequent call to CreateEndpoint to create the endpoint with a cross-account.

nested_items.name: DynamoDbSettings
nested_items.description: The settings for the DynamoDB target endpoint. For more information, see the DynamoDBSettings structure.

nested_items.name: ServiceAccessRoleArn
nested_items.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) used by the service to access the IAM role. The role must allow the iam:PassRole action.

nested_items.name: S3Settings
nested_items.description: The settings for the S3 target endpoint. For more information, see the S3Settings structure.

nested_items.name: ServiceAccessRoleArn
nested_items.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) used by the service to access the IAM role. The role must allow the iam:PassRole action. It is a required parameter that enables DMS to write and read objects from an S3 bucket.

nested_items.name: ExternalTableDefinition
nested_items.description: Specifies how tables are defined in the S3 source files only.

nested_items.name: CsvRowDelimiter
nested_items.description: The delimiter used to separate rows in the .csv file for both source and target. The default is a carriage return ( \n).

nested_items.name: CsvDelimiter
nested_items.description: The delimiter used to separate columns in the .csv file for both source and target. The default is a comma.

nested_items.name: BucketFolder
nested_items.description: An optional parameter to set a folder name in the S3 bucket. If provided, tables are created in the path bucketFolder/schema_name/table_name/. If this parameter isn't specified, then the path used is schema_name/table_name/.

nested_items.name: BucketName
nested_items.description: The name of the S3 bucket.

nested_items.name: CompressionType
nested_items.description: An optional parameter to use GZIP to compress the target files. Set to GZIP to compress the target files. Either set this parameter to NONE (the default) or don't use it to leave the files uncompressed. This parameter applies to both .csv and .parquet file formats.

nested_items.name: EncryptionMode
nested_items.description: The type of server-side encryption that you want to use for your data. This encryption type is part of the endpoint settings or the extra connections attributes for Amazon S3. You can choose either SSE_S3 (the default) or SSE_KMS.
s3:CreateBucket.
s3:ListBucket.
s3:DeleteBucket.
s3:GetBucketLocation.
s3:GetObject.
s3:PutObject.
s3:DeleteObject.
s3:GetObjectVersion.
s3:GetBucketPolicy.
s3:PutBucketPolicy.
s3:DeleteBucketPolicy.

nested_items.name: ServerSideEncryptionKmsKeyId
nested_items.description: If you are using SSE_KMS for the EncryptionMode, provide the KMS key ID. The key that you use needs an attached policy that enables Identity and Access Management (IAM) user permissions and allows use of the key.

nested_items.name: DataFormat
nested_items.description: The format of the data that you want to use for output. You can choose one of the following:
csv : This is a row-based file format with comma-separated values (.csv).
parquet : Apache Parquet (.parquet) is a columnar storage file format that features efficient compression and provides faster query response.

nested_items.name: EncodingType
nested_items.description: The type of encoding you are using:
RLE_DICTIONARY uses a combination of bit-packing and run-length encoding to store repeated values more efficiently. This is the default.
PLAIN doesn't use encoding at all. Values are stored as they are.
PLAIN_DICTIONARY builds a dictionary of the values encountered in a given column. The dictionary is stored in a dictionary page for each column chunk.

nested_items.name: DictPageSizeLimit
nested_items.description: The maximum size of an encoded dictionary page of a column. If the dictionary page exceeds this, this column is stored using an encoding type of PLAIN. This parameter defaults to 1024 * 1024 bytes (1 MiB), the maximum size of a dictionary page before it reverts to PLAIN encoding. This size is used for .parquet file format only.

nested_items.name: RowGroupLength
nested_items.description: The number of rows in a row group. A smaller row group size provides faster reads. But as the number of row groups grows, the slower writes become. This parameter defaults to 10,000 rows. This number is used for .parquet file format only.

nested_items.name: DataPageSize
nested_items.description: The size of one data page in bytes. This parameter defaults to 1024 * 1024 bytes (1 MiB). This number is used for .parquet file format only.

nested_items.name: ParquetVersion
nested_items.description: The version of the Apache Parquet format that you want to use: parquet_1_0 (the default) or parquet_2_0.

nested_items.name: EnableStatistics
nested_items.description: A value that enables statistics for Parquet pages and row groups. Choose true to enable statistics, false to disable. Statistics include NULL, DISTINCT, MAX, and MIN values. This parameter defaults to true. This value is used for .parquet file format only.

nested_items.name: IncludeOpForFullLoad
nested_items.description: A value that enables a full load to write INSERT operations to the comma-separated value (.csv) or .parquet output files only to indicate how the rows were added to the source database.

nested_items.name: CdcInsertsOnly
nested_items.description: A value that enables a change data capture (CDC) load to write only INSERT operations to .csv or columnar storage (.parquet) output files. By default (the false setting), the first field in a .csv or .parquet record contains the letter I (INSERT), U (UPDATE), or D (DELETE). These values indicate whether the row was inserted, updated, or deleted at the source database for a CDC load to the target.

nested_items.name: TimestampColumnName
nested_items.description: A value that when nonblank causes DMS to add a column with timestamp information to the endpoint data for an Amazon S3 target.

nested_items.name: ParquetTimestampInMillisecond
nested_items.description: A value that specifies the precision of any TIMESTAMP column values that are written to an Amazon S3 object file in .parquet format.

nested_items.name: CdcInsertsAndUpdates
nested_items.description: A value that enables a change data capture (CDC) load to write INSERT and UPDATE operations to .csv or .parquet (columnar storage) output files. The default setting is false, but when CdcInsertsAndUpdates is set to true or y, only INSERTs and UPDATEs from the source database are migrated to the .csv or .parquet file.

nested_items.name: DatePartitionEnabled
nested_items.description: When set to true, this parameter partitions S3 bucket folders based on transaction commit dates. The default value is false. For more information about date-based folder partitioning, see Using date-based folder partitioning.

nested_items.name: DatePartitionSequence
nested_items.description: Identifies the sequence of the date format to use during folder partitioning. The default value is YYYYMMDD. Use this parameter when DatePartitionedEnabled is set to true.

nested_items.name: DatePartitionDelimiter
nested_items.description: Specifies a date separating delimiter to use during folder partitioning. The default value is SLASH. Use this parameter when DatePartitionedEnabled is set to true.

nested_items.name: UseCsvNoSupValue
nested_items.description: This setting applies if the S3 output files during a change data capture (CDC) load are written in .csv format. If set to true for columns not included in the supplemental log, DMS uses the value specified by CsvNoSupValue. If not set or set to false, DMS uses the null value for these columns.

nested_items.name: CsvNoSupValue
nested_items.description: This setting only applies if your Amazon S3 output files during a change data capture (CDC) load are written in .csv format. If UseCsvNoSupValue is set to true, specify a string value that you want DMS to use for all columns not included in the supplemental log. If you do not specify a string value, DMS uses the null value for these columns regardless of the UseCsvNoSupValue setting.

nested_items.name: PreserveTransactions
nested_items.description: If set to true, DMS saves the transaction order for a change data capture (CDC) load on the Amazon S3 target specified by CdcPath. For more information, see Capturing data changes (CDC) including transaction order on the S3 target.

nested_items.name: CdcPath
nested_items.description: Specifies the folder path of CDC files. For an S3 source, this setting is required if a task captures change data; otherwise, it's optional. If CdcPath is set, DMS reads CDC files from this path and replicates the data changes to the target endpoint. For an S3 target if you set PreserveTransactions to true, DMS verifies that you have set this parameter to a folder path on your S3 target where DMS can save the transaction order for the CDC load. DMS creates this CDC folder path in either your S3 target working directory or the S3 target location specified by BucketFolder and BucketName.

nested_items.name: UseTaskStartTimeForFullLoadTimestamp
nested_items.description: When set to true, this parameter uses the task start time as the timestamp column value instead of the time data is written to target. For full load, when useTaskStartTimeForFullLoadTimestamp is set to true, each row of the timestamp column contains the task start time. For CDC loads, each row of the timestamp column contains the transaction commit time.

nested_items.name: CannedAclForObjects
nested_items.description: A value that enables DMS to specify a predefined (canned) access control list for objects created in an Amazon S3 bucket as .csv or .parquet files. For more information about Amazon S3 canned ACLs, see Canned ACL in the Amazon S3 Developer Guide.

nested_items.name: AddColumnName
nested_items.description: An optional parameter that, when set to true or y, you can use to add column name information to the .csv output file.

nested_items.name: CdcMaxBatchInterval
nested_items.description: Maximum length of the interval, defined in seconds, after which to output a file to Amazon S3.

nested_items.name: CdcMinFileSize
nested_items.description: Minimum file size, defined in kilobytes, to reach for a file output to Amazon S3.

nested_items.name: CsvNullValue
nested_items.description: An optional parameter that specifies how DMS treats null values. While handling the null value, you can use this parameter to pass a user-defined string as null when writing to the target. For example, when target columns are nullable, you can use this option to differentiate between the empty string value and the null value. So, if you set this parameter value to the empty string ('' or --'), DMS treats the empty string as the null value instead of NULL.

nested_items.name: IgnoreHeaderRows
nested_items.description: When this value is set to 1, DMS ignores the first row header in a .csv file. A value of 1 turns on the feature; a value of 0 turns off the feature.

nested_items.name: MaxFileSize
nested_items.description: A value that specifies the maximum size (in KB) of any .csv file to be created while migrating to an S3 target during full load.

nested_items.name: Rfc4180
nested_items.description: For an S3 source, when this value is set to true or y, each leading double quotation mark has to be followed by an ending double quotation mark. This formatting complies with RFC 4180. When this value is set to false or n, string literals are copied to the target as is. In this case, a delimiter (row or column) signals the end of the field. Thus, you can't use a delimiter as part of the string, because it signals the end of the value.

nested_items.name: DatePartitionTimezone
nested_items.description: When creating an S3 target endpoint, set DatePartitionTimezone to convert the current UTC time into a specified time zone. The conversion occurs when a date partition folder is created and a CDC filename is generated. The time zone format is Area/Location. Use this parameter when DatePartitionedEnabled is set to true, as shown in the following example.

nested_items.name: AddTrailingPaddingCharacter
nested_items.description: Use the S3 target endpoint setting AddTrailingPaddingCharacter to add padding on string data. The default value is false.

nested_items.name: ExpectedBucketOwner
nested_items.description: To specify a bucket owner and prevent sniping, you can use the ExpectedBucketOwner endpoint setting.

nested_items.name: GlueCatalogGeneration
nested_items.description: When true, allows Glue to catalog your S3 bucket. Creating an Glue catalog lets you use Athena to query your data.

nested_items.name: DmsTransferSettings
nested_items.description: The settings for the DMS Transfer type source. For more information, see the DmsTransferSettings structure.

nested_items.name: ServiceAccessRoleArn
nested_items.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) used by the service access IAM role. The role must allow the iam:PassRole action.

nested_items.name: BucketName
nested_items.description: The name of the S3 bucket to use.

nested_items.name: MongoDbSettings
nested_items.description: The settings for the MongoDB source endpoint. For more information, see the MongoDbSettings structure.

nested_items.name: Username
nested_items.description: The user name you use to access the MongoDB source endpoint.

nested_items.name: Password
nested_items.description: The password for the user account you use to access the MongoDB source endpoint.

nested_items.name: ServerName
nested_items.description: The name of the server on the MongoDB source endpoint. For MongoDB Atlas, provide the server name for any of the servers in the replication set.

nested_items.name: Port
nested_items.description: The port value for the MongoDB source endpoint.

nested_items.name: DatabaseName
nested_items.description: The database name on the MongoDB source endpoint.

nested_items.name: AuthType
nested_items.description: The authentication type you use to access the MongoDB source endpoint.

nested_items.name: AuthMechanism
nested_items.description: The authentication mechanism you use to access the MongoDB source endpoint.

nested_items.name: NestingLevel
nested_items.description: Specifies either document or table mode.

nested_items.name: ExtractDocId
nested_items.description: Specifies the document ID. Use this setting when NestingLevel is set to "none".

nested_items.name: DocsToInvestigate
nested_items.description: Indicates the number of documents to preview to determine the document organization. Use this setting when NestingLevel is set to "one".

nested_items.name: AuthSource
nested_items.description: The MongoDB database name. This setting isn't used when AuthType is set to "no".

nested_items.name: KmsKeyId
nested_items.description: The KMS key identifier that is used to encrypt the content on the replication instance. If you don't specify a value for the KmsKeyId parameter, then DMS uses your default encryption key. KMS creates the default encryption key for your Amazon Web Services account. Your Amazon Web Services account has a different default encryption key for each Amazon Web Services Region.

nested_items.name: SecretsManagerAccessRoleArn
nested_items.description: The full Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the IAM role that specifies DMS as the trusted entity and grants the required permissions to access the value in SecretsManagerSecret. The role must allow the iam:PassRole action. SecretsManagerSecret has the value of the Amazon Web Services Secrets Manager secret that allows access to the MongoDB endpoint.

nested_items.name: SecretsManagerSecretId
nested_items.description: The full ARN, partial ARN, or friendly name of the SecretsManagerSecret that contains the MongoDB endpoint connection details.

nested_items.name: UseUpdateLookUp
nested_items.description: If true, DMS retrieves the entire document from the MongoDB source during migration. This may cause a migration failure if the server response exceeds bandwidth limits. To fetch only updates and deletes during migration, set this parameter to false.

nested_items.name: ReplicateShardCollections
nested_items.description: If true, DMS replicates data to shard collections. DMS only uses this setting if the target endpoint is a DocumentDB elastic cluster.
You must set TargetTablePrepMode to nothing.
DMS automatically sets useUpdateLookup to false.

nested_items.name: KinesisSettings
nested_items.description: The settings for the Amazon Kinesis target endpoint. For more information, see the KinesisSettings structure.

nested_items.name: StreamArn
nested_items.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) for the Amazon Kinesis Data Streams endpoint.

nested_items.name: MessageFormat
nested_items.description: The output format for the records created on the endpoint. The message format is JSON (default) or JSON_UNFORMATTED (a single line with no tab).

nested_items.name: ServiceAccessRoleArn
nested_items.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) for the IAM role that DMS uses to write to the Kinesis data stream. The role must allow the iam:PassRole action.

nested_items.name: IncludeTransactionDetails
nested_items.description: Provides detailed transaction information from the source database. This information includes a commit timestamp, a log position, and values for transaction_id, previous transaction_id, and transaction_record_id (the record offset within a transaction). The default is false.

nested_items.name: IncludePartitionValue
nested_items.description: Shows the partition value within the Kinesis message output, unless the partition type is schema-table-type. The default is false.

nested_items.name: PartitionIncludeSchemaTable
nested_items.description: Prefixes schema and table names to partition values, when the partition type is primary-key-type. Doing this increases data distribution among Kinesis shards. For example, suppose that a SysBench schema has thousands of tables and each table has only limited range for a primary key. In this case, the same primary key is sent from thousands of tables to the same shard, which causes throttling. The default is false.

nested_items.name: IncludeTableAlterOperations
nested_items.description: Includes any data definition language (DDL) operations that change the table in the control data, such as rename-table, drop-table, add-column, drop-column, and rename-column. The default is false.

nested_items.name: IncludeControlDetails
nested_items.description: Shows detailed control information for table definition, column definition, and table and column changes in the Kinesis message output. The default is false.

nested_items.name: IncludeNullAndEmpty
nested_items.description: Include NULL and empty columns for records migrated to the endpoint. The default is false.

nested_items.name: NoHexPrefix
nested_items.description: Set this optional parameter to true to avoid adding a --0x' prefix to raw data in hexadecimal format. For example, by default, DMS adds a --0x' prefix to the LOB column type in hexadecimal format moving from an Oracle source to an Amazon Kinesis target. Use the NoHexPrefix endpoint setting to enable migration of RAW data type columns without adding the --0x' prefix.

nested_items.name: UseLargeIntegerValue
nested_items.description: Specifies using the large integer value with Kinesis.

nested_items.name: KafkaSettings
nested_items.description: The settings for the Apache Kafka target endpoint. For more information, see the KafkaSettings structure.

nested_items.name: Broker
nested_items.description: A comma-separated list of one or more broker locations in your Kafka cluster that host your Kafka instance. Specify each broker location in the form broker-hostname-or-ip:port ``. For example, ``"ec2-12-345-678-901.compute-1.amazonaws.com:2345". For more information and examples of specifying a list of broker locations, see Using Apache Kafka as a target for Database Migration Service in the Database Migration Service User Guide.

nested_items.name: Topic
nested_items.description: The topic to which you migrate the data. If you don't specify a topic, DMS specifies "kafka-default-topic" as the migration topic.

nested_items.name: MessageFormat
nested_items.description: The output format for the records created on the endpoint. The message format is JSON (default) or JSON_UNFORMATTED (a single line with no tab).

nested_items.name: IncludeTransactionDetails
nested_items.description: Provides detailed transaction information from the source database. This information includes a commit timestamp, a log position, and values for transaction_id, previous transaction_id, and transaction_record_id (the record offset within a transaction). The default is false.

nested_items.name: IncludePartitionValue
nested_items.description: Shows the partition value within the Kafka message output unless the partition type is schema-table-type. The default is false.

nested_items.name: PartitionIncludeSchemaTable
nested_items.description: Prefixes schema and table names to partition values, when the partition type is primary-key-type. Doing this increases data distribution among Kafka partitions. For example, suppose that a SysBench schema has thousands of tables and each table has only limited range for a primary key. In this case, the same primary key is sent from thousands of tables to the same partition, which causes throttling. The default is false.

nested_items.name: IncludeTableAlterOperations
nested_items.description: Includes any data definition language (DDL) operations that change the table in the control data, such as rename-table, drop-table, add-column, drop-column, and rename-column. The default is false.

nested_items.name: IncludeControlDetails
nested_items.description: Shows detailed control information for table definition, column definition, and table and column changes in the Kafka message output. The default is false.

nested_items.name: MessageMaxBytes
nested_items.description: The maximum size in bytes for records created on the endpoint The default is 1,000,000.

nested_items.name: IncludeNullAndEmpty
nested_items.description: Include NULL and empty columns for records migrated to the endpoint. The default is false.

nested_items.name: SecurityProtocol
nested_items.description: Set secure connection to a Kafka target endpoint using Transport Layer Security (TLS). Options include ssl-encryption, ssl-authentication, and sasl-ssl. sasl-ssl requires SaslUsername and SaslPassword.

nested_items.name: SslClientCertificateArn
nested_items.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the client certificate used to securely connect to a Kafka target endpoint.

nested_items.name: SslClientKeyArn
nested_items.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) for the client private key used to securely connect to a Kafka target endpoint.

nested_items.name: SslClientKeyPassword
nested_items.description: The password for the client private key used to securely connect to a Kafka target endpoint.

nested_items.name: SslCaCertificateArn
nested_items.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) for the private certificate authority (CA) cert that DMS uses to securely connect to your Kafka target endpoint.

nested_items.name: SaslUsername
nested_items.description: The secure user name you created when you first set up your MSK cluster to validate a client identity and make an encrypted connection between server and client using SASL-SSL authentication.

nested_items.name: SaslPassword
nested_items.description: The secure password you created when you first set up your MSK cluster to validate a client identity and make an encrypted connection between server and client using SASL-SSL authentication.

nested_items.name: NoHexPrefix
nested_items.description: Set this optional parameter to true to avoid adding a --0x' prefix to raw data in hexadecimal format. For example, by default, DMS adds a --0x' prefix to the LOB column type in hexadecimal format moving from an Oracle source to a Kafka target. Use the NoHexPrefix endpoint setting to enable migration of RAW data type columns without adding the --0x' prefix.

nested_items.name: SaslMechanism
nested_items.description: For SASL/SSL authentication, DMS supports the SCRAM-SHA-512 mechanism by default. DMS versions 3.5.0 and later also support the PLAIN mechanism. To use the PLAIN mechanism, set this parameter to PLAIN.

nested_items.name: SslEndpointIdentificationAlgorithm
nested_items.description: Sets hostname verification for the certificate. This setting is supported in DMS version 3.5.1 and later.

nested_items.name: UseLargeIntegerValue
nested_items.description: Specifies using the large integer value with Kafka.

nested_items.name: ElasticsearchSettings
nested_items.description: The settings for the OpenSearch source endpoint. For more information, see the ElasticsearchSettings structure.

nested_items.name: ServiceAccessRoleArn
nested_items.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) used by the service to access the IAM role. The role must allow the iam:PassRole action.

nested_items.name: EndpointUri
nested_items.description: The endpoint for the OpenSearch cluster. DMS uses HTTPS if a transport protocol (http/https) is not specified.

nested_items.name: FullLoadErrorPercentage
nested_items.description: The maximum percentage of records that can fail to be written before a full load operation stops.

nested_items.name: ErrorRetryDuration
nested_items.description: The maximum number of seconds for which DMS retries failed API requests to the OpenSearch cluster.

nested_items.name: UseNewMappingType
nested_items.description: Set this option to true for DMS to migrate documentation using the documentation type _doc. OpenSearch and an Elasticsearch cluster only support the _doc documentation type in versions 7. x and later. The default value is false.

nested_items.name: NeptuneSettings
nested_items.description: The settings for the Amazon Neptune target endpoint. For more information, see the NeptuneSettings structure.

nested_items.name: ServiceAccessRoleArn
nested_items.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the service role that you created for the Neptune target endpoint. The role must allow the iam:PassRole action. For more information, see Creating an IAM Service Role for Accessing Amazon Neptune as a Target in the Database Migration Service User Guide.

nested_items.name: S3BucketName
nested_items.description: The name of the Amazon S3 bucket where DMS can temporarily store migrated graph data in .csv files before bulk-loading it to the Neptune target database. DMS maps the SQL source data to graph data before storing it in these .csv files.

nested_items.name: S3BucketFolder
nested_items.description: A folder path where you want DMS to store migrated graph data in the S3 bucket specified by S3BucketName.

nested_items.name: ErrorRetryDuration
nested_items.description: The number of milliseconds for DMS to wait to retry a bulk-load of migrated graph data to the Neptune target database before raising an error. The default is 250.

nested_items.name: MaxFileSize
nested_items.description: The maximum size in kilobytes of migrated graph data stored in a .csv file before DMS bulk-loads the data to the Neptune target database. The default is 1,048,576 KB. If the bulk load is successful, DMS clears the bucket, ready to store the next batch of migrated graph data.

nested_items.name: MaxRetryCount
nested_items.description: The number of times for DMS to retry a bulk load of migrated graph data to the Neptune target database before raising an error. The default is 5.

nested_items.name: IamAuthEnabled
nested_items.description: If you want Identity and Access Management (IAM) authorization enabled for this endpoint, set this parameter to true. Then attach the appropriate IAM policy document to your service role specified by ServiceAccessRoleArn. The default is false.

nested_items.name: RedshiftSettings
nested_items.description: Settings for the Amazon Redshift endpoint.

nested_items.name: AcceptAnyDate
nested_items.description: A value that indicates to allow any date format, including invalid formats such as 00/00/00 00:00:00, to be loaded without generating an error. You can choose true or false (the default).

nested_items.name: AfterConnectScript
nested_items.description: Code to run after connecting. This parameter should contain the code itself, not the name of a file containing the code.

nested_items.name: BucketFolder
nested_items.description: An S3 folder where the comma-separated-value (.csv) files are stored before being uploaded to the target Redshift cluster.

nested_items.name: BucketName
nested_items.description: The name of the intermediate S3 bucket used to store .csv files before uploading data to Redshift.

nested_items.name: CaseSensitiveNames
nested_items.description: If Amazon Redshift is configured to support case sensitive schema names, set CaseSensitiveNames to true. The default is false.

nested_items.name: CompUpdate
nested_items.description: If you set CompUpdate to true Amazon Redshift applies automatic compression if the table is empty. This applies even if the table columns already have encodings other than RAW. If you set CompUpdate to false, automatic compression is disabled and existing column encodings aren't changed. The default is true.

nested_items.name: ConnectionTimeout
nested_items.description: A value that sets the amount of time to wait (in milliseconds) before timing out, beginning from when you initially establish a connection.

nested_items.name: DatabaseName
nested_items.description: The name of the Amazon Redshift data warehouse (service) that you are working with.

nested_items.name: DateFormat
nested_items.description: The date format that you are using. Valid values are auto (case-sensitive), your date format string enclosed in quotes, or NULL. If this parameter is left unset (NULL), it defaults to a format of --YYYY-MM-DD'. Using auto recognizes most strings, even some that aren't supported when you use a date format string.

nested_items.name: EmptyAsNull
nested_items.description: A value that specifies whether DMS should migrate empty CHAR and VARCHAR fields as NULL. A value of true sets empty CHAR and VARCHAR fields to null. The default is false.

nested_items.name: EncryptionMode
nested_items.description: The type of server-side encryption that you want to use for your data. This encryption type is part of the endpoint settings or the extra connections attributes for Amazon S3. You can choose either SSE_S3 (the default) or SSE_KMS.

nested_items.name: ExplicitIds
nested_items.description: This setting is only valid for a full-load migration task. Set ExplicitIds to true to have tables with IDENTITY columns override their auto-generated values with explicit values loaded from the source data files used to populate the tables. The default is false.

nested_items.name: FileTransferUploadStreams
nested_items.description: The number of threads used to upload a single file. This parameter accepts a value from 1 through 64. It defaults to 10.

nested_items.name: LoadTimeout
nested_items.description: The amount of time to wait (in milliseconds) before timing out of operations performed by DMS on a Redshift cluster, such as Redshift COPY, INSERT, DELETE, and UPDATE.

nested_items.name: MaxFileSize
nested_items.description: The maximum size (in KB) of any .csv file used to load data on an S3 bucket and transfer data to Amazon Redshift. It defaults to 1048576KB (1 GB).

nested_items.name: Password
nested_items.description: The password for the user named in the username property.

nested_items.name: Port
nested_items.description: The port number for Amazon Redshift. The default value is 5439.

nested_items.name: RemoveQuotes
nested_items.description: A value that specifies to remove surrounding quotation marks from strings in the incoming data. All characters within the quotation marks, including delimiters, are retained. Choose true to remove quotation marks. The default is false.

nested_items.name: ReplaceInvalidChars
nested_items.description: A list of characters that you want to replace. Use with ReplaceChars.

nested_items.name: ReplaceChars
nested_items.description: A value that specifies to replaces the invalid characters specified in ReplaceInvalidChars, substituting the specified characters instead. The default is "?".

nested_items.name: ServerName
nested_items.description: The name of the Amazon Redshift cluster you are using.

nested_items.name: ServiceAccessRoleArn
nested_items.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the IAM role that has access to the Amazon Redshift service. The role must allow the iam:PassRole action.

nested_items.name: ServerSideEncryptionKmsKeyId
nested_items.description: The KMS key ID. If you are using SSE_KMS for the EncryptionMode, provide this key ID. The key that you use needs an attached policy that enables IAM user permissions and allows use of the key.

nested_items.name: TimeFormat
nested_items.description: The time format that you want to use. Valid values are auto (case-sensitive), 'timeformat_string', 'epochsecs', or 'epochmillisecs'. It defaults to 10. Using auto recognizes most strings, even some that aren't supported when you use a time format string.

nested_items.name: TrimBlanks
nested_items.description: A value that specifies to remove the trailing white space characters from a VARCHAR string. This parameter applies only to columns with a VARCHAR data type. Choose true to remove unneeded white space. The default is false.

nested_items.name: TruncateColumns
nested_items.description: A value that specifies to truncate data in columns to the appropriate number of characters, so that the data fits in the column. This parameter applies only to columns with a VARCHAR or CHAR data type, and rows with a size of 4 MB or less. Choose true to truncate data. The default is false.

nested_items.name: Username
nested_items.description: An Amazon Redshift user name for a registered user.

nested_items.name: WriteBufferSize
nested_items.description: The size (in KB) of the in-memory file write buffer used when generating .csv files on the local disk at the DMS replication instance. The default value is 1000 (buffer size is 1000KB).

nested_items.name: SecretsManagerAccessRoleArn
nested_items.description: The full Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the IAM role that specifies DMS as the trusted entity and grants the required permissions to access the value in SecretsManagerSecret. The role must allow the iam:PassRole action. SecretsManagerSecret has the value of the Amazon Web Services Secrets Manager secret that allows access to the Amazon Redshift endpoint.

nested_items.name: SecretsManagerSecretId
nested_items.description: The full ARN, partial ARN, or friendly name of the SecretsManagerSecret that contains the Amazon Redshift endpoint connection details.

nested_items.name: MapBooleanAsBoolean
nested_items.description: When true, lets Redshift migrate the boolean type as boolean. By default, Redshift migrates booleans as varchar(1). You must set this setting on both the source and target endpoints for it to take effect.

nested_items.name: PostgreSQLSettings
nested_items.description: The settings for the PostgreSQL source and target endpoint. For more information, see the PostgreSQLSettings structure.

nested_items.name: AfterConnectScript
nested_items.description: For use with change data capture (CDC) only, this attribute has DMS bypass foreign keys and user triggers to reduce the time it takes to bulk load data.

nested_items.name: CaptureDdls
nested_items.description: To capture DDL events, DMS creates various artifacts in the PostgreSQL database when the task starts. You can later remove these artifacts.

nested_items.name: MaxFileSize
nested_items.description: Specifies the maximum size (in KB) of any .csv file used to transfer data to PostgreSQL.

nested_items.name: DatabaseName
nested_items.description: Database name for the endpoint.

nested_items.name: DdlArtifactsSchema
nested_items.description: The schema in which the operational DDL database artifacts are created.

nested_items.name: ExecuteTimeout
nested_items.description: Sets the client statement timeout for the PostgreSQL instance, in seconds. The default value is 60 seconds.

nested_items.name: FailTasksOnLobTruncation
nested_items.description: When set to true, this value causes a task to fail if the actual size of a LOB column is greater than the specified LobMaxSize.

nested_items.name: HeartbeatEnable
nested_items.description: The write-ahead log (WAL) heartbeat feature mimics a dummy transaction. By doing this, it prevents idle logical replication slots from holding onto old WAL logs, which can result in storage full situations on the source. This heartbeat keeps restart_lsn moving and prevents storage full scenarios.

nested_items.name: HeartbeatSchema
nested_items.description: Sets the schema in which the heartbeat artifacts are created.

nested_items.name: HeartbeatFrequency
nested_items.description: Sets the WAL heartbeat frequency (in minutes).

nested_items.name: Password
nested_items.description: Endpoint connection password.

nested_items.name: Port
nested_items.description: Endpoint TCP port. The default is 5432.

nested_items.name: ServerName
nested_items.description: The host name of the endpoint database.

nested_items.name: Username
nested_items.description: Endpoint connection user name.

nested_items.name: SlotName
nested_items.description: Sets the name of a previously created logical replication slot for a change data capture (CDC) load of the PostgreSQL source instance.

nested_items.name: PluginName
nested_items.description: Specifies the plugin to use to create a replication slot.

nested_items.name: SecretsManagerAccessRoleArn
nested_items.description: The full Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the IAM role that specifies DMS as the trusted entity and grants the required permissions to access the value in SecretsManagerSecret. The role must allow the iam:PassRole action. SecretsManagerSecret has the value of the Amazon Web Services Secrets Manager secret that allows access to the PostgreSQL endpoint.

nested_items.name: SecretsManagerSecretId
nested_items.description: The full ARN, partial ARN, or friendly name of the SecretsManagerSecret that contains the PostgreSQL endpoint connection details.

nested_items.name: TrimSpaceInChar
nested_items.description: Use the TrimSpaceInChar source endpoint setting to trim data on CHAR and NCHAR data types during migration. The default value is true.

nested_items.name: MapBooleanAsBoolean
nested_items.description: When true, lets PostgreSQL migrate the boolean type as boolean. By default, PostgreSQL migrates booleans as varchar(5). You must set this setting on both the source and target endpoints for it to take effect.

nested_items.name: MapJsonbAsClob
nested_items.description: When true, DMS migrates JSONB values as CLOB.

nested_items.name: MapLongVarcharAs
nested_items.description: Sets what datatype to map LONG values as.

nested_items.name: DatabaseMode
nested_items.description: Specifies the default behavior of the replication's handling of PostgreSQL- compatible endpoints that require some additional configuration, such as Babelfish endpoints.

nested_items.name: BabelfishDatabaseName
nested_items.description: The Babelfish for Aurora PostgreSQL database name for the endpoint.

nested_items.name: DisableUnicodeSourceFilter
nested_items.description: Disables the Unicode source filter with PostgreSQL, for values passed into the Selection rule filter on Source Endpoint column values. By default DMS performs source filter comparisons using a Unicode string which can cause look ups to ignore the indexes in the text columns and slow down migrations.

nested_items.name: MySQLSettings
nested_items.description: The settings for the MySQL source and target endpoint. For more information, see the MySQLSettings structure.

nested_items.name: AfterConnectScript
nested_items.description: Specifies a script to run immediately after DMS connects to the endpoint. The migration task continues running regardless if the SQL statement succeeds or fails.

nested_items.name: CleanSourceMetadataOnMismatch
nested_items.description: Cleans and recreates table metadata information on the replication instance when a mismatch occurs. For example, in a situation where running an alter DDL on the table could result in different information about the table cached in the replication instance.

nested_items.name: DatabaseName
nested_items.description: Database name for the endpoint. For a MySQL source or target endpoint, don't explicitly specify the database using the DatabaseName request parameter on either the CreateEndpoint or ModifyEndpoint API call. Specifying DatabaseName when you create or modify a MySQL endpoint replicates all the task tables to this single database. For MySQL endpoints, you specify the database only when you specify the schema in the table-mapping rules of the DMS task.

nested_items.name: EventsPollInterval
nested_items.description: Specifies how often to check the binary log for new changes/events when the database is idle. The default is five seconds.

nested_items.name: TargetDbType
nested_items.description: Specifies where to migrate source tables on the target, either to a single database or multiple databases. If you specify SPECIFIC_DATABASE, specify the database name using the DatabaseName parameter of the Endpoint object.

nested_items.name: MaxFileSize
nested_items.description: Specifies the maximum size (in KB) of any .csv file used to transfer data to a MySQL-compatible database.

nested_items.name: ParallelLoadThreads
nested_items.description: Improves performance when loading data into the MySQL-compatible target database. Specifies how many threads to use to load the data into the MySQL-compatible target database. Setting a large number of threads can have an adverse effect on database performance, because a separate connection is required for each thread. The default is one.

nested_items.name: Password
nested_items.description: Endpoint connection password.

nested_items.name: Port
nested_items.description: Endpoint TCP port.

nested_items.name: ServerName
nested_items.description: The host name of the endpoint database.

nested_items.name: ServerTimezone
nested_items.description: Specifies the time zone for the source MySQL database.

nested_items.name: Username
nested_items.description: Endpoint connection user name.

nested_items.name: SecretsManagerAccessRoleArn
nested_items.description: The full Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the IAM role that specifies DMS as the trusted entity and grants the required permissions to access the value in SecretsManagerSecret. The role must allow the iam:PassRole action. SecretsManagerSecret has the value of the Amazon Web Services Secrets Manager secret that allows access to the MySQL endpoint.

nested_items.name: SecretsManagerSecretId
nested_items.description: The full ARN, partial ARN, or friendly name of the SecretsManagerSecret that contains the MySQL endpoint connection details.

nested_items.name: ExecuteTimeout
nested_items.description: Sets the client statement timeout (in seconds) for a MySQL source endpoint.

nested_items.name: OracleSettings
nested_items.description: The settings for the Oracle source and target endpoint. For more information, see the OracleSettings structure.

nested_items.name: AddSupplementalLogging
nested_items.description: Set this attribute to set up table-level supplemental logging for the Oracle database. This attribute enables PRIMARY KEY supplemental logging on all tables selected for a migration task.

nested_items.name: ArchivedLogDestId
nested_items.description: Specifies the ID of the destination for the archived redo logs. This value should be the same as a number in the dest_id column of the v$archived_log view. If you work with an additional redo log destination, use the AdditionalArchivedLogDestId option to specify the additional destination ID. Doing this improves performance by ensuring that the correct logs are accessed from the outset.

nested_items.name: AdditionalArchivedLogDestId
nested_items.description: Set this attribute with ArchivedLogDestId in a primary/ standby setup. This attribute is useful in the case of a switchover. In this case, DMS needs to know which destination to get archive redo logs from to read changes. This need arises because the previous primary instance is now a standby instance after switchover.

nested_items.name: ExtraArchivedLogDestIds
nested_items.description: Specifies the IDs of one more destinations for one or more archived redo logs. These IDs are the values of the dest_id column in the v$archived_log view. Use this setting with the archivedLogDestId extra connection attribute in a primary-to-single setup or a primary-to-multiple-standby setup.
(integer) ---

nested_items.name: AllowSelectNestedTables
nested_items.description: Set this attribute to true to enable replication of Oracle tables containing columns that are nested tables or defined types.

nested_items.name: ParallelAsmReadThreads
nested_items.description: Set this attribute to change the number of threads that DMS configures to perform a change data capture (CDC) load using Oracle Automatic Storage Management (ASM). You can specify an integer value between 2 (the default) and 8 (the maximum). Use this attribute together with the readAheadBlocks attribute.

nested_items.name: ReadAheadBlocks
nested_items.description: Set this attribute to change the number of read-ahead blocks that DMS configures to perform a change data capture (CDC) load using Oracle Automatic Storage Management (ASM). You can specify an integer value between 1000 (the default) and 200,000 (the maximum).

nested_items.name: AccessAlternateDirectly
nested_items.description: Set this attribute to false in order to use the Binary Reader to capture change data for an Amazon RDS for Oracle as the source. This tells the DMS instance to not access redo logs through any specified path prefix replacement using direct file access.

nested_items.name: UseAlternateFolderForOnline
nested_items.description: Set this attribute to true in order to use the Binary Reader to capture change data for an Amazon RDS for Oracle as the source. This tells the DMS instance to use any specified prefix replacement to access all online redo logs.

nested_items.name: OraclePathPrefix
nested_items.description: Set this string attribute to the required value in order to use the Binary Reader to capture change data for an Amazon RDS for Oracle as the source. This value specifies the default Oracle root used to access the redo logs.

nested_items.name: UsePathPrefix
nested_items.description: Set this string attribute to the required value in order to use the Binary Reader to capture change data for an Amazon RDS for Oracle as the source. This value specifies the path prefix used to replace the default Oracle root to access the redo logs.

nested_items.name: ReplacePathPrefix
nested_items.description: Set this attribute to true in order to use the Binary Reader to capture change data for an Amazon RDS for Oracle as the source. This setting tells DMS instance to replace the default Oracle root with the specified usePathPrefix setting to access the redo logs.

nested_items.name: EnableHomogenousTablespace
nested_items.description: Set this attribute to enable homogenous tablespace replication and create existing tables or indexes under the same tablespace on the target.

nested_items.name: DirectPathNoLog
nested_items.description: When set to true, this attribute helps to increase the commit rate on the Oracle target database by writing directly to tables and not writing a trail to database logs.

nested_items.name: ArchivedLogsOnly
nested_items.description: When this field is set to True, DMS only accesses the archived redo logs. If the archived redo logs are stored on Automatic Storage Management (ASM) only, the DMS user account needs to be granted ASM privileges.

nested_items.name: AsmPassword
nested_items.description: For an Oracle source endpoint, your Oracle Automatic Storage Management (ASM) password. You can set this value from the asm_user_password value. You set this value as part of the comma-separated value that you set to the Password request parameter when you create the endpoint to access transaction logs using Binary Reader. For more information, see Configuration for change data capture (CDC) on an Oracle source database.

nested_items.name: AsmServer
nested_items.description: For an Oracle source endpoint, your ASM server address. You can set this value from the asm_server value. You set asm_server as part of the extra connection attribute string to access an Oracle server with Binary Reader that uses ASM. For more information, see Configuration for change data capture (CDC) on an Oracle source database.

nested_items.name: AsmUser
nested_items.description: For an Oracle source endpoint, your ASM user name. You can set this value from the asm_user value. You set asm_user as part of the extra connection attribute string to access an Oracle server with Binary Reader that uses ASM. For more information, see Configuration for change data capture (CDC) on an Oracle source database.

nested_items.name: CharLengthSemantics
nested_items.description: Specifies whether the length of a character column is in bytes or in characters. To indicate that the character column length is in characters, set this attribute to CHAR. Otherwise, the character column length is in bytes.

nested_items.name: DatabaseName
nested_items.description: Database name for the endpoint.

nested_items.name: DirectPathParallelLoad
nested_items.description: When set to true, this attribute specifies a parallel load when useDirectPathFullLoad is set to Y. This attribute also only applies when you use the DMS parallel load feature. Note that the target table cannot have any constraints or indexes.

nested_items.name: FailTasksOnLobTruncation
nested_items.description: When set to true, this attribute causes a task to fail if the actual size of an LOB column is greater than the specified LobMaxSize.

nested_items.name: NumberDatatypeScale
nested_items.description: Specifies the number scale. You can select a scale up to 38, or you can select FLOAT. By default, the NUMBER data type is converted to precision 38, scale 10.

nested_items.name: Password
nested_items.description: Endpoint connection password.

nested_items.name: Port
nested_items.description: Endpoint TCP port.

nested_items.name: ReadTableSpaceName
nested_items.description: When set to true, this attribute supports tablespace replication.

nested_items.name: RetryInterval
nested_items.description: Specifies the number of seconds that the system waits before resending a query.

nested_items.name: SecurityDbEncryption
nested_items.description: For an Oracle source endpoint, the transparent data encryption (TDE) password required by AWM DMS to access Oracle redo logs encrypted by TDE using Binary Reader. It is also the TDE_Password part of the comma-separated value you set to the Password request parameter when you create the endpoint. The SecurityDbEncryptian setting is related to this SecurityDbEncryptionName setting. For more information, see Supported encryption methods for using Oracle as a source for DMS in the Database Migration Service User Guide.

nested_items.name: SecurityDbEncryptionName
nested_items.description: For an Oracle source endpoint, the name of a key used for the transparent data encryption (TDE) of the columns and tablespaces in an Oracle source database that is encrypted using TDE. The key value is the value of the SecurityDbEncryption setting. For more information on setting the key name value of SecurityDbEncryptionName, see the information and example for setting the securityDbEncryptionName extra connection attribute in Supported encryption methods for using Oracle as a source for DMS in the Database Migration Service User Guide.

nested_items.name: ServerName
nested_items.description: Fully qualified domain name of the endpoint.

nested_items.name: SpatialDataOptionToGeoJsonFunctionName
nested_items.description: Use this attribute to convert SDO_GEOMETRY to GEOJSON format. By default, DMS calls the SDO2GEOJSON custom function if present and accessible. Or you can create your own custom function that mimics the operation of SDOGEOJSON and set SpatialDataOptionToGeoJsonFunctionName to call it instead.

nested_items.name: StandbyDelayTime
nested_items.description: Use this attribute to specify a time in minutes for the delay in standby sync. If the source is an Oracle Active Data Guard standby database, use this attribute to specify the time lag between primary and standby databases.

nested_items.name: Username
nested_items.description: Endpoint connection user name.

nested_items.name: UseBFile
nested_items.description: Set this attribute to True to capture change data using the Binary Reader utility. Set UseLogminerReader to False to set this attribute to True. To use Binary Reader with Amazon RDS for Oracle as the source, you set additional attributes. For more information about using this setting with Oracle Automatic Storage Management (ASM), see Using Oracle LogMiner or DMS Binary Reader for CDC.

nested_items.name: UseDirectPathFullLoad
nested_items.description: Set this attribute to True to have DMS use a direct path full load. Specify this value to use the direct path protocol in the Oracle Call Interface (OCI). By using this OCI protocol, you can bulk-load Oracle target tables during a full load.

nested_items.name: UseLogminerReader
nested_items.description: Set this attribute to True to capture change data using the Oracle LogMiner utility (the default). Set this attribute to False if you want to access the redo logs as a binary file. When you set UseLogminerReader to False, also set UseBfile to True. For more information on this setting and using Oracle ASM, see Using Oracle LogMiner or DMS Binary Reader for CDC in the DMS User Guide.

nested_items.name: SecretsManagerAccessRoleArn
nested_items.description: The full Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the IAM role that specifies DMS as the trusted entity and grants the required permissions to access the value in SecretsManagerSecret. The role must allow the iam:PassRole action. SecretsManagerSecret has the value of the Amazon Web Services Secrets Manager secret that allows access to the Oracle endpoint.

nested_items.name: SecretsManagerSecretId
nested_items.description: The full ARN, partial ARN, or friendly name of the SecretsManagerSecret that contains the Oracle endpoint connection details.

nested_items.name: SecretsManagerOracleAsmAccessRoleArn
nested_items.description: Required only if your Oracle endpoint uses Automatic Storage Management (ASM). The full ARN of the IAM role that specifies DMS as the trusted entity and grants the required permissions to access the SecretsManagerOracleAsmSecret. This SecretsManagerOracleAsmSecret has the secret value that allows access to the Oracle ASM of the endpoint.

nested_items.name: SecretsManagerOracleAsmSecretId
nested_items.description: Required only if your Oracle endpoint uses Automatic Storage Management (ASM). The full ARN, partial ARN, or friendly name of the SecretsManagerOracleAsmSecret that contains the Oracle ASM connection details for the Oracle endpoint.

nested_items.name: TrimSpaceInChar
nested_items.description: Use the TrimSpaceInChar source endpoint setting to trim data on CHAR and NCHAR data types during migration. The default value is true.

nested_items.name: ConvertTimestampWithZoneToUTC
nested_items.description: When true, converts timestamps with the timezone datatype to their UTC value.

nested_items.name: OpenTransactionWindow
nested_items.description: The timeframe in minutes to check for open transactions for a CDC-only task.

nested_items.name: AuthenticationMethod
nested_items.description: Specifies the authentication method to be used with Oracle.

nested_items.name: SybaseSettings
nested_items.description: The settings for the SAP ASE source and target endpoint. For more information, see the SybaseSettings structure.

nested_items.name: DatabaseName
nested_items.description: Database name for the endpoint.

nested_items.name: Password
nested_items.description: Endpoint connection password.

nested_items.name: Port
nested_items.description: Endpoint TCP port. The default is 5000.

nested_items.name: ServerName
nested_items.description: Fully qualified domain name of the endpoint.

nested_items.name: Username
nested_items.description: Endpoint connection user name.

nested_items.name: SecretsManagerAccessRoleArn
nested_items.description: The full Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the IAM role that specifies DMS as the trusted entity and grants the required permissions to access the value in SecretsManagerSecret. The role must allow the iam:PassRole action. SecretsManagerSecret has the value of the Amazon Web Services Secrets Manager secret that allows access to the SAP ASE endpoint.

nested_items.name: SecretsManagerSecretId
nested_items.description: The full ARN, partial ARN, or friendly name of the SecretsManagerSecret that contains the SAP SAE endpoint connection details.

nested_items.name: MicrosoftSQLServerSettings
nested_items.description: The settings for the Microsoft SQL Server source and target endpoint. For more information, see the MicrosoftSQLServerSettings structure.

nested_items.name: Port
nested_items.description: Endpoint TCP port.

nested_items.name: BcpPacketSize
nested_items.description: The maximum size of the packets (in bytes) used to transfer data using BCP.

nested_items.name: DatabaseName
nested_items.description: Database name for the endpoint.

nested_items.name: ControlTablesFileGroup
nested_items.description: Specifies a file group for the DMS internal tables. When the replication task starts, all the internal DMS control tables (awsdms_ apply_exception, awsdms_apply, awsdms_changes) are created for the specified file group.

nested_items.name: Password
nested_items.description: Endpoint connection password.

nested_items.name: QuerySingleAlwaysOnNode
nested_items.description: Cleans and recreates table metadata information on the replication instance when a mismatch occurs. An example is a situation where running an alter DDL statement on a table might result in different information about the table cached in the replication instance.

nested_items.name: ReadBackupOnly
nested_items.description: When this attribute is set to Y, DMS only reads changes from transaction log backups and doesn't read from the active transaction log file during ongoing replication. Setting this parameter to Y enables you to control active transaction log file growth during full load and ongoing replication tasks. However, it can add some source latency to ongoing replication.

nested_items.name: SafeguardPolicy
nested_items.description: Use this attribute to minimize the need to access the backup log and enable DMS to prevent truncation using one of the following two methods.

nested_items.name: ServerName
nested_items.description: Fully qualified domain name of the endpoint. For an Amazon RDS SQL Server instance, this is the output of DescribeDBInstances, in the Endpoint.Address field.

nested_items.name: Username
nested_items.description: Endpoint connection user name.

nested_items.name: UseBcpFullLoad
nested_items.description: Use this to attribute to transfer data for full-load operations using BCP. When the target table contains an identity column that does not exist in the source table, you must disable the use BCP for loading table option.

nested_items.name: UseThirdPartyBackupDevice
nested_items.description: When this attribute is set to Y, DMS processes third-party transaction log backups if they are created in native format.

nested_items.name: SecretsManagerAccessRoleArn
nested_items.description: The full Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the IAM role that specifies DMS as the trusted entity and grants the required permissions to access the value in SecretsManagerSecret. The role must allow the iam:PassRole action. SecretsManagerSecret has the value of the Amazon Web Services Secrets Manager secret that allows access to the SQL Server endpoint.

nested_items.name: SecretsManagerSecretId
nested_items.description: The full ARN, partial ARN, or friendly name of the SecretsManagerSecret that contains the SQL Server endpoint connection details.

nested_items.name: TrimSpaceInChar
nested_items.description: Use the TrimSpaceInChar source endpoint setting to right-trim data on CHAR and NCHAR data types during migration. Setting TrimSpaceInChar does not left-trim data. The default value is true.

nested_items.name: TlogAccessMode
nested_items.description: Indicates the mode used to fetch CDC data.

nested_items.name: ForceLobLookup
nested_items.description: Forces LOB lookup on inline LOB.

nested_items.name: AuthenticationMethod
nested_items.description: Specifies the authentication method to be used with Microsoft SQL Server.

nested_items.name: IBMDb2Settings
nested_items.description: The settings for the IBM Db2 LUW source endpoint. For more information, see the IBMDb2Settings structure.

nested_items.name: DatabaseName
nested_items.description: Database name for the endpoint.

nested_items.name: Password
nested_items.description: Endpoint connection password.

nested_items.name: Port
nested_items.description: Endpoint TCP port. The default value is 50000.

nested_items.name: ServerName
nested_items.description: Fully qualified domain name of the endpoint.

nested_items.name: SetDataCaptureChanges
nested_items.description: Enables ongoing replication (CDC) as a BOOLEAN value. The default is true.

nested_items.name: CurrentLsn
nested_items.description: For ongoing replication (CDC), use CurrentLSN to specify a log sequence number (LSN) where you want the replication to start.

nested_items.name: MaxKBytesPerRead
nested_items.description: Maximum number of bytes per read, as a NUMBER value. The default is 64 KB.

nested_items.name: Username
nested_items.description: Endpoint connection user name.

nested_items.name: SecretsManagerAccessRoleArn
nested_items.description: The full Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the IAM role that specifies DMS as the trusted entity and grants the required permissions to access the value in SecretsManagerSecret. The role must allow the iam:PassRole action. SecretsManagerSecret has the value of the Amazon Web Services Secrets Manager secret that allows access to the Db2 LUW endpoint.

nested_items.name: SecretsManagerSecretId
nested_items.description: The full ARN, partial ARN, or friendly name of the SecretsManagerSecret that contains the Db2 LUW endpoint connection details.

nested_items.name: LoadTimeout
nested_items.description: The amount of time (in milliseconds) before DMS times out operations performed by DMS on the Db2 target. The default value is 1200 (20 minutes).

nested_items.name: WriteBufferSize
nested_items.description: The size (in KB) of the in-memory file write buffer used when generating .csv files on the local disk on the DMS replication instance. The default value is 1024 (1 MB).

nested_items.name: MaxFileSize
nested_items.description: Specifies the maximum size (in KB) of .csv files used to transfer data to Db2 LUW.

nested_items.name: KeepCsvFiles
nested_items.description: If true, DMS saves any .csv files to the Db2 LUW target that were used to replicate data. DMS uses these files for analysis and troubleshooting.

nested_items.name: DocDbSettings
nested_items.description: Provides information that defines a DocumentDB endpoint.

nested_items.name: Username
nested_items.description: The user name you use to access the DocumentDB source endpoint.

nested_items.name: Password
nested_items.description: The password for the user account you use to access the DocumentDB source endpoint.

nested_items.name: ServerName
nested_items.description: The name of the server on the DocumentDB source endpoint.

nested_items.name: Port
nested_items.description: The port value for the DocumentDB source endpoint.

nested_items.name: DatabaseName
nested_items.description: The database name on the DocumentDB source endpoint.

nested_items.name: NestingLevel
nested_items.description: Specifies either document or table mode.

nested_items.name: ExtractDocId
nested_items.description: Specifies the document ID. Use this setting when NestingLevel is set to "none".

nested_items.name: DocsToInvestigate
nested_items.description: Indicates the number of documents to preview to determine the document organization. Use this setting when NestingLevel is set to "one".

nested_items.name: KmsKeyId
nested_items.description: The KMS key identifier that is used to encrypt the content on the replication instance. If you don't specify a value for the KmsKeyId parameter, then DMS uses your default encryption key. KMS creates the default encryption key for your Amazon Web Services account. Your Amazon Web Services account has a different default encryption key for each Amazon Web Services Region.

nested_items.name: SecretsManagerAccessRoleArn
nested_items.description: The full Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the IAM role that specifies DMS as the trusted entity and grants the required permissions to access the value in SecretsManagerSecret. The role must allow the iam:PassRole action. SecretsManagerSecret has the value of the Amazon Web Services Secrets Manager secret that allows access to the DocumentDB endpoint.

nested_items.name: SecretsManagerSecretId
nested_items.description: The full ARN, partial ARN, or friendly name of the SecretsManagerSecret that contains the DocumentDB endpoint connection details.

nested_items.name: UseUpdateLookUp
nested_items.description: If true, DMS retrieves the entire document from the DocumentDB source during migration. This may cause a migration failure if the server response exceeds bandwidth limits. To fetch only updates and deletes during migration, set this parameter to false.

nested_items.name: ReplicateShardCollections
nested_items.description: If true, DMS replicates data to shard collections. DMS only uses this setting if the target endpoint is a DocumentDB elastic cluster.
You must set TargetTablePrepMode to nothing.
DMS automatically sets useUpdateLookup to false.

nested_items.name: RedisSettings
nested_items.description: The settings for the Redis target endpoint. For more information, see the RedisSettings structure.

nested_items.name: ServerName
nested_items.description: Fully qualified domain name of the endpoint.

nested_items.name: Port
nested_items.description: Transmission Control Protocol (TCP) port for the endpoint.

nested_items.name: SslSecurityProtocol
nested_items.description: The connection to a Redis target endpoint using Transport Layer Security (TLS). Valid values include plaintext and ssl-encryption. The default is ssl-encryption. The ssl-encryption option makes an encrypted connection. Optionally, you can identify an Amazon Resource Name (ARN) for an SSL certificate authority (CA) using the ``SslCaCertificateArn ``setting. If an ARN isn't given for a CA, DMS uses the Amazon root CA.

nested_items.name: AuthType
nested_items.description: The type of authentication to perform when connecting to a Redis target. Options include none, auth-token, and auth-role. The auth-token option requires an AuthPassword value to be provided. The auth-role option requires AuthUserName and AuthPassword values to be provided.

nested_items.name: AuthUserName
nested_items.description: The user name provided with the auth-role option of the AuthType setting for a Redis target endpoint.

nested_items.name: AuthPassword
nested_items.description: The password provided with the auth-role and auth-token options of the AuthType setting for a Redis target endpoint.

nested_items.name: SslCaCertificateArn
nested_items.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) for the certificate authority (CA) that DMS uses to connect to your Redis target endpoint.

nested_items.name: GcpMySQLSettings
nested_items.description: Settings in JSON format for the source GCP MySQL endpoint.

nested_items.name: AfterConnectScript
nested_items.description: Specifies a script to run immediately after DMS connects to the endpoint. The migration task continues running regardless if the SQL statement succeeds or fails.

nested_items.name: CleanSourceMetadataOnMismatch
nested_items.description: Cleans and recreates table metadata information on the replication instance when a mismatch occurs. For example, in a situation where running an alter DDL on the table could result in different information about the table cached in the replication instance.

nested_items.name: DatabaseName
nested_items.description: Database name for the endpoint. For a MySQL source or target endpoint, don't explicitly specify the database using the DatabaseName request parameter on either the CreateEndpoint or ModifyEndpoint API call. Specifying DatabaseName when you create or modify a MySQL endpoint replicates all the task tables to this single database. For MySQL endpoints, you specify the database only when you specify the schema in the table-mapping rules of the DMS task.

nested_items.name: EventsPollInterval
nested_items.description: Specifies how often to check the binary log for new changes/events when the database is idle. The default is five seconds.

nested_items.name: TargetDbType
nested_items.description: Specifies where to migrate source tables on the target, either to a single database or multiple databases.

nested_items.name: MaxFileSize
nested_items.description: Specifies the maximum size (in KB) of any .csv file used to transfer data to a MySQL-compatible database.

nested_items.name: ParallelLoadThreads
nested_items.description: Improves performance when loading data into the MySQL-compatible target database. Specifies how many threads to use to load the data into the MySQL-compatible target database. Setting a large number of threads can have an adverse effect on database performance, because a separate connection is required for each thread. The default is one.

nested_items.name: Password
nested_items.description: Endpoint connection password.

nested_items.name: Port
nested_items.description: Endpoint TCP port.

nested_items.name: ServerName
nested_items.description: The MySQL host name.

nested_items.name: ServerTimezone
nested_items.description: Specifies the time zone for the source MySQL database.

nested_items.name: Username
nested_items.description: Endpoint connection user name.

nested_items.name: SecretsManagerAccessRoleArn
nested_items.description: The full Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the IAM role that specifies DMS as the trusted entity and grants the required permissions to access the value in SecretsManagerSecret. The role must allow the iam:PassRole action. SecretsManagerSecret has the value of the Amazon Web Services Secrets Manager secret that allows access to the MySQL endpoint.

nested_items.name: SecretsManagerSecretId
nested_items.description: The full ARN, partial ARN, or friendly name of the SecretsManagerSecret that contains the MySQL endpoint connection details.

nested_items.name: TimestreamSettings
nested_items.description: The settings for the Amazon Timestream target endpoint. For more information, see the TimestreamSettings structure.

nested_items.name: DatabaseName
nested_items.description: Database name for the endpoint.

nested_items.name: MemoryDuration
nested_items.description: Set this attribute to specify the length of time to store all of the tables in memory that are migrated into Amazon Timestream from the source database. Time is measured in units of hours. When Timestream data comes in, it first resides in memory for the specified duration, which allows quick access to it.

nested_items.name: MagneticDuration
nested_items.description: Set this attribute to specify the default magnetic duration applied to the Amazon Timestream tables in days. This is the number of days that records remain in magnetic store before being discarded. For more information, see Storage in the Amazon Timestream Developer Guide.

nested_items.name: CdcInsertsAndUpdates
nested_items.description: Set this attribute to true to specify that DMS only applies inserts and updates, and not deletes. Amazon Timestream does not allow deleting records, so if this value is false, DMS nulls out the corresponding record in the Timestream database rather than deleting it.

nested_items.name: EnableMagneticStoreWrites
nested_items.description: Set this attribute to true to enable memory store writes. When this value is false, DMS does not write records that are older in days than the value specified in MagneticDuration, because Amazon Timestream does not allow memory writes by default. For more information, see Storage in the Amazon Timestream Developer Guide.
